title: The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
text: package provides bridge Bioconductor vast, homogeneously-processed transcriptomic data refine.bio. Cite refine.bio project : Casey S. Greene, Dongbo Hu, Richard W. W. Jones, Stephanie Liu, David S. Mejia, Rob Patro, Stephen R. Piccolo, Ariel Rodriguez Romero, Hirak Sarkar, Candace L. Savonen, Jaclyn N. Taroni, William E. Vauclain, Deepashree Venkatesh Prasad, Kurt G. Wheeler. refine.bio: resource uniformly processed publicly available gene expression datasets. URL: https://www.refine.bio

title: The bridge between refine.bio and Bioconductor
text: project undergoing active development meant general use.

title: All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
text: periodically release compendia comprised samples species able process. refer refine.bio compendia. offer two kinds refine.bio compendia:count Normalized compendia RNA-seq compendia types compendia available download RefineBio website. details compendia generated described RefineBio site documentation summarized convenience.

title: All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
text: Refine.bio normalized compendia comprised samples species able process, aggregate, normalize. Normalized compendia provide snapshot complete collection gene expression refine.bio can produce supported organism. process compendia manner different options available via web user interface. Note submitter processed samples available web user interface omitted normalized compendia samples can introduce unwanted technical variation. refine.bio web interface inner join datasets combined, genes present datasets included final matrix. compendia, take union genes, filling missing values NA. “full outer join” illustrated RefineBio site documentation. use full outer join allows us retain genes compendium impute missing values compendia creation.

title: All available compendia in refine.bio — rb_compendia_list
text: refine.bio RNA-seq sample compendia comprised Salmon output collection RNA-seq samples organism processed refine.bio. individual sample quant.sf file; samples aggregated normalized. RNA-seq sample compendia designed allow users comfortable handling files generate output useful downstream applications. Please see Salmon documentation quant.sf output format information.

what: Helper function for getting entity lists — rb_entity_list
title: Helper function for getting entity lists — rb_entity_list
text: Helper function getting entity lists

title: Helper function for getting entity lists — rb_entity_list
Helper function for getting entity lists — rb_entity_list
text: endpoint character(1) endpoint get data . paginate logical(1) Whether paginate results.

title: Helper function for getting entity lists — rb_entity_list
text: data.frame results query.

title: Helper function for getting entity lists — rb_entity_list
text: Sean Davis seandavi@gmail.com

title: Helper function for getting entity lists — rb_entity_list

what: Get experiment data for a single experiment — rb_experiment_details
title: Get experiment data for a single experiment — rb_experiment_details
text: Experiments top level refine.bio hierarchy. collections samples processed together. function returns metadata giving information experiment, well list samples part experiment.

title: Get experiment data for a single experiment — rb_experiment_details
Get experiment data for a single experiment — rb_experiment_details
text: accession_code accession code experiment, e.g. 'SRP150473'

title: Get experiment data for a single experiment — rb_experiment_details
text: list following elements: id: ID experiment title: title experiment description: description experiment annotations: list annotations experiment samples: data.frame sample metadata protocol_description: description protocol used experiment accession_code: accession code experiment alternate_accession_code: alternate accession code experiment source_database: database experiment downloaded source_url: URL experiment downloaded has_publication: Whether experiment publication associated publication_title: title publication associated experiment publication_doi: DOI publication associated experiment publication_authors: authors publication associated experiment pubmed_id: PubMed ID publication associated experiment source_first_published: date experiment first published source_last_modified: date experiment last modified submitter_institution: institution submitted experiment last_modified: date experiment last modified created_at: date experiment created organism_names: names organisms experiment sample_metadata: types metadata available samples experiment num_total_samples: total number samples experiment num_processed_samples: number samples experiment processed num_downloadable_samples: number samples experiment downloadable

title: Get experiment data for a single experiment — rb_experiment_details
code: expt_details <- rb_experiment("SRP150473") #> Error in rb_experiment("SRP150473"): could not find function "rb_experiment"  expt_details$accession_code #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'expt_details' not found expt_details$source_database #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'expt_details' not found head(expt_details$samples) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'expt_details' not found expt_details$sample_metadata #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'expt_details' not found expt_details$num_total_samples #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'expt_details' not found expt_details$num_processed_samples #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'expt_details' not found expt_details$num_downloadable_samples #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'expt_details' not found

title: Search for experiments — rb_experiment_search
text: Search experiments

title: Search for experiments — rb_experiment_search
code: rb_experiment_search(   id = NULL,   technology = NULL,   has_publication = NULL,   accession_code = NULL,   alternate_accession_code = NULL,   platform = NULL,   organism = NULL,   downloadable_organism = NULL,   num_processed_samples = NULL,   num_downloadable_samples = NULL,   sample_keywords = NULL,   ordering = NULL,   search = NULL,   pages = Inf,   limit = 1000,   .progress = TRUE,   offset = 0 )

title: Search for experiments — rb_experiment_search
code: experiments <- rb_experiment_search(   search = "(pediatric) AND (medulloblastoma)", ) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘dplyr’  head(experiments) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'experiments' not found

what: Create or get an active API token for use in downloading from the API — rb_get_token
title: Create or get an active API token for use in downloading from the API — rb_get_token
text: API token mechanism refine.bio uses relatively simple. "authentication" per se, just acknowledgement agreement terms conditions use. token needed download data. functionality work fine without .

title: Create or get an active API token for use in downloading from the API — rb_get_token
Create or get an active API token for use in downloading from the API — rb_get_token
text: Upon calling function first time session, token successfully obtained activated, stored session memory. calls use cached value. new R session result new API token.

what: All available institutions in refine.bio — rb_institution_list
title: All available institutions in refine.bio — rb_institution_list
text: available institutions refine.bio

title: All available institutions in refine.bio — rb_institution_list
All available institutions in refine.bio — rb_institution_list
text: data.frame available submitter institutions.

title: All available institutions in refine.bio — rb_institution_list
text: Sean Davis seandavi@gmail.com

title: All available institutions in refine.bio — rb_institution_list
code: insts <- rb_institution_list() head(insts) #>                                                                                                               submitter_institution #> 1                                                                                                  Huazhong agricultural university #> 2                                                                                                     Takeda Pharmaceutical Company #> 3                                                                                                           UC Davis Medical Center #> 4 Radiobiology Unit, Molecular and Cellular Biology, Inst. Environment, Health and Safety, Belgian Nuclear Research Centre, SCK-CEN #> 5                                            Children's Hospital of Philadelphia, and University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine #> 6                                                                                     Women & Infants Hospital/Brown Medical School

title: All available organisms in refine.bio — rb_organism_list

code: orgs <- rb_organism_list() head(orgs) #>                   name taxonomy_id has_compendia has_quantfile_compendia #> 1   CIONA_INTESTINALIS        7719            NA                      NA #> 2           MUS_PAHARI       10093         FALSE                    TRUE #> 3 NOTAMACROPUS_EUGENII        9315         FALSE                    TRUE #> 4  TAENIOPYGIA_GUTTATA       59729            NA                      NA #> 5   PETROMYZON_MARINUS        7757            NA                      NA #> 6   ANAS_PLATYRHYNCHOS        8839            NA                      NA

title: All available platforms in refine.bio — rb_platform_list
All available platforms in refine.bio — rb_platform_list
code: platforms <- rb_platform_list() head(platforms) #>    platform_accession_code #> 1             IonTorrentS5 #> 2              ovigene10st #> 3                  GPL4861 #> 4 Illumina_MouseRef-8_v2.0 #> 5                 GPL16365 #> 6                 GPL16275 #>                                                         platform_name #> 1                                                      Ion Torrent S5 #> 2                            [OviGene-1_0-st] Ovine Gene 1.1 ST Array #> 3                         Swegene Human 27K RAP (positions from file) #> 4          Illumina MouseRef-8 v2.0 expression beadchip (ILMN_SYMBOL) #> 5                                  Candida albicans tiling ChIP array #> 6 Agilent-035430 mouse miRNA array (miRNA_107_Sep09 miRNA ID version)
